1 #!/usr/bin/python
2 from functools import partial
3 from operator import is_not
4 from sys import excepthook
5 
6 import numpy as np
7 import rospy
8 from rospy import Header, Publisher, Subscriber
9 from geometry_msgs.msg import PoseStamped
10 from sensor_msgs.msg import PointCloud2, PointField, CameraInfo
11 from sensor_msgs import point_cloud2
12 import tf
13 import traceback
14 import image_geometry
15 from ros_crop_estimation.msg import ObjectDetected, ObjectsInImg
16 from cv_bridge import CvBridge, CvBridgeError
17 import cv2
18 
19 
20 class LocalObjectLocator:
21  """
22  The YoloObjectLocator publishes a point cloud that includes the detected positions of grape-bunches.
23  This is done by subscribing to the robot's camera and extracting grape image positions from the image.
24  These image positions are then used to infer the position of the grape using image-to-world transforms.
25  """
26 
27  pc_pub = None
28  img_sub = None
29  detected_positions = None
30  detector_model = None
31  color2depth_aspect = (84.1/1920) / (70.0/512)
32  visualisation = True
33  camera_model = None
34  tf_listener = None
35 
36  def __init__(self, pub_name="/object_detector/objects_pointcloud", sub_name="/object_detector/object_detected"):
37  """
38  Initialize the object locator.
39  @param pub_name: the name of the publisher to publish the point cloud
40  @type pub_name: str
41  @param sub_name: the name of the subscriber to subscribe to the object detection topic
42  @type sub_name: str
43  """
44 
45  rospy.init_node("local_object_locator", log_level=rospy.INFO)
46 
47  self.pc_pub = Publisher(
48  pub_name, data_class=PointCloud2, queue_size=10)
49  self.img_sub = Subscriber(
50  sub_name, data_class=ObjectsInImg, callback=self.detect_objects_in_img)
51 
52  self.camera_model = image_geometry.PinholeCameraModel()
53  self.bridge = CvBridge()
54 
55  self.tf_listener = tf.TransformListener()
56 
57  def detect_objects_in_img(self, objects_in_im):
58  """
59  This function is called when a new image is received from the camera.
60  @param objects_in_im: The objects detected in the image.
61  @type objects_in_im: ObjectsInImg
62  @return: None
63  """
64 
65  rospy.logdebug("detected objects!")
66 
67  object_positions = self.get_pixel_positions_from_objects_detected(
68  objects_in_im.objects_detected)
69 
70  world_positions = self.get_cam_coords_from_img_positions(object_positions,
71  objects_in_im.im_depth, objects_in_im.im_color, objects_in_im.camera_info_color)
72 
73  fields = [PointField('x', 0, PointField.FLOAT32, 1),
74  PointField('y', 4, PointField.FLOAT32, 1),
75  PointField('z', 8, PointField.FLOAT32, 1),
76  # PointField('rgb', 12, PointField.UINT32, 1),
77  #PointField('rgba', 12, PointField.UINT32, 1),
78  ]
79 
80  header = Header()
81  header.frame_id = "map"
82  header.stamp = objects_in_im.im_color.header.stamp
83 
84  point_cloud = point_cloud2.create_cloud(
85  header, fields, world_positions)
86 
87  self.pc_pub.publish(point_cloud)
88 
89  def get_pixel_positions_from_objects_detected(self, objects_detected):
90  """
91  get the pixel positions of the objects detected in the image.
92 
93  @param objects_detected: The objects detected in the image.
94  @type objects_detected: ObjectDetected
95  @return: The pixel positions of the objects detected in the image.
96  """
97  return [object_detected.bbox.center for object_detected in objects_detected]
98 
99  def get_cam_coords_from_img_positions(self, im_pixel_positions, im_depth, im_color, camera_info):
100  """
101  get the camera coordinates of the objects detected in the image.
102 
103  @param im_pixel_positions: The pixel positions of the objects detected in the image.
104  @type im_pixel_positions: list of tuples
105  @param im_depth: The depth image.
106  @type im_depth: Image
107  @param im_color: The color image.
108  @type im_color: Image
109  @param camera_info: The camera info.
110  @type camera_info: CameraInfo
111  @return: The camera coordinates of the objects detected in the image.
112  """
113  coords = np.array([], dtype=float)
114  coords.shape = (-1, 3)
115 
116  camera_model = image_geometry.PinholeCameraModel()
117  camera_model.fromCameraInfo(camera_info)
118 
119  image_color = None
120  image_depth = None
121 
122  # covert images to open_cv
123  try:
124  image_color = self.bridge.imgmsg_to_cv2(im_color, "bgr8")
125  image_depth = self.bridge.imgmsg_to_cv2(im_depth, "32FC1")
126 
127  except CvBridgeError as e:
128  rospy.logerr(e)
129  return None
130 
131  # "map" from color to depth image
132  rospy.logdebug("image shapes: " +
133  str(image_color.shape) + str(image_depth.shape))
134 
135  image_coords = []
136  depth_coords = []
137 
138  for pixel_position in im_pixel_positions:
139 
140  image_coord = (pixel_position.y, pixel_position.x)
141  image_coords.append(image_coord)
142  # "map" from color to depth image
143  depth_coord = (image_depth.shape[0]/2 + (image_coord[0] - image_color.shape[0]/2)*self.color2depth_aspect,
144  image_depth.shape[1]/2 + (image_coord[1] - image_color.shape[1]/2)*self.color2depth_aspect)
145  depth_coords.append(depth_coord)
146 
147  self.tf_listener.waitForTransform(
148  'map', camera_info.header.frame_id, im_color.header.stamp, rospy.Duration.from_sec(1))
149 
150  for depth_coord, image_coord in zip(depth_coords, image_coords):
151  try:
152  # get the depth reading at the centroid location
153  # you might need to do some boundary checking first!
154  depth_value = image_depth[int(
155  depth_coord[0]), int(depth_coord[1])]
156 
157  if depth_value > 100:
158  continue
159 
160  # calculate object's 3d location in camera coords
161  # project the image coords (x,y) into 3D ray in camera coords
162  camera_coord = camera_model.projectPixelTo3dRay(
163  (image_coord[1], image_coord[0]))
164  # adjust the resulting vector so that z = 1
165  camera_coord = [x/camera_coord[2] for x in camera_coord]
166  # multiply the vector by depth
167  camera_coord = [x*depth_value for x in camera_coord]
168 
169  # define a point in camera coordinates
170  object_location = PoseStamped()
171  object_location.header.stamp = im_color.header.stamp
172  object_location.header.frame_id = camera_info.header.frame_id
173  rospy.logdebug_throttle(
174  5, "frame_id: %s" % (camera_info.header.frame_id))
175  object_location.pose.orientation.w = 1.0
176  object_location.pose.position.x = camera_coord[0]
177  object_location.pose.position.y = camera_coord[1]
178  object_location.pose.position.z = camera_coord[2]
179 
180  object_location_map = self.tf_listener.transformPose(
181  'map', object_location)
182  obj_pos = object_location_map.pose.position
183 
184  coords = np.append(
185  coords, [[obj_pos.x, obj_pos.y, obj_pos.z]], axis=0)
186  rospy.logdebug_throttle(
187  5, "world coordinates: " + str([[obj_pos.x, obj_pos.y, obj_pos.z]]))
188  except IndexError as e:
189  continue
190  except Exception as e:
191  rospy.logerr_throttle(5, traceback.format_exc())
192  rospy.logerr_throttle(
193  5, "Transformation to deph or camera corrdinates failed!")
194  rospy.logerr_throttle(5, "\t \t Color, \t \t image")
195  rospy.logerr_throttle(
196  5, "size:\t" + str(image_color.shape) + "," + str(image_depth.shape))
197  rospy.logerr_throttle(
198  5, "coord:\t" + "(" + str(image_coord[0]) + "," + str(image_coord[1]) + "),\t" + str(depth_coord))
199  continue
200 
201  if self.visualisation and im_color is not None:
202  # covert images to open_cv
203  try:
204  # draw circles
205  for image_coord, depth_coord in zip(image_coords, depth_coords):
206  cv2.circle(image_color, (int(image_coord[1]), int(
207  image_coord[0])), 10, 255, -1)
208  cv2.circle(image_depth, (int(depth_coord[1]), int(
209  depth_coord[0])), 5, 255, -1)
210 
211  # resize and adjust for visualisation
212  image_color = cv2.resize(image_color, (0, 0), fx=0.5, fy=0.5)
213  # scale for visualisation (max range 10.0 m)
214  image_depth *= 1.0/10.0
215 
216  cv2.imshow("image depth", image_depth)
217  cv2.imshow("image color", image_color)
218  cv2.waitKey(1)
219  except Exception as e:
220  # rospy.logerr(e)
221  rospy.logerr_throttle(5, e)
222 
223  return coords
224 
225 
226 if __name__ == "__main__":
227  try:
228  LocalObjectLocator()
229  rospy.spin()
230 
231  except:
232  pass
